intro: Echinophora exoacantha, commonly known as the hairy echinophora, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
